Posts.Content: Hi CJ, So glad to hear from you, I am new to this site and not to sure what I am doing. I am glad to hear you are doing great. I am going to be starting chemo soon, than radiation after. I am still recovering from the surgery. Just a lot of numbness and pain on my left side where my lymph nodes were removed. Still cant believe I am going through this but I have a positive attitude. Keep in touch if you are able to. Thanks, JoJo
Posts.Title: Armpit

Posts.Content: Hi, I recently found a swollen lymp node under my left arm pit, I am 39 and just went through a bilateral mastectomy. I had a mamo, mri and biopsy on my left breast and found out I have breast cancer, Never felt a lump, You may be fine, but please do not wait.
Posts.Title: Armpit

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by Bernice I went to my doctor. She thinks it's a swollen lymph node. She doesn't think it's anything to worry about. She checked my breasts and didn't find anything. I'm having my yearly mammogram in May and she wants me to go back to her that week and if this lump is still there, she'll send me to a specialist and maybe have a biopsy done on it. Isn't 6 weeks too long to wait and not do anything? Is there anything I can do to help it go away? I'm not going to shave as much under my arm. I shave every other day. Maybe I'll shave once a week. She said it's like when you have a cold and the lymph nodes in your neck swells. That's just like under your arm. I really never heard that your lumph nodes under your arm can swell (causing a lump) from shaving. Anyone heard of that? I never had any problems before. I just hope this lump goes away. Bernice
Posts.Title: Armpit

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by JOJO39 Hi, I recently found a swollen lymp node under my left arm pit, I am 39 and just went through a bilateral mastectomy. I had a mamo, mri and biopsy on my left breast and found out I have breast cancer, Never felt a lump, You may be fine, but please do not wait.
Posts.Title: Armpit

Posts.Content: Hi Guys, I am so glad you both found this board. It is great and so many awesome people. Marilyn, what type of biposy are you having? I had the ultrasound and the stereotatic (sp) biopsy. I got through them fine, just have to lay still. The ultrasound one was much easier. I have stage 2 cancer, had a double mast and now going through chemo. Honestly the waiting is the worst, but you guys look like you will be just fine. I am so happy for you both, ask a lot of questions and get a great support group. I will pray for you guys. Anytime you need to vent or talk I would be glad to listen. JoJo
Posts.Title: Going For Diagnostic Mammogram

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by cjammom Hi JOJO, I too have had bc..a 4yr survivor..Just wanted to say hi.. Sorry that you had to go through that..I had a mast. also..its a tough thing. Are you starting any kind of treatment? chemo or rads? I did just chemo, then took tamoxifen and am now on arimidex. I havent had any recurrances, and count my blessings every day.. Hope your feeling well Keep in touch if you can, cj
Posts.Title: Armpit

Posts.Content: Hello, Good luck tomorrow. You will be fine, just relax and breathe. You can do it. It will be over before you know it. I will say a prayer for you. Take Care, JoJo
Posts.Title: Going For Diagnostic Mammogram

Posts.Content: Hi guys, I had a double mast in April 07, went through chemo. On Sept 5 I had expanders put in, then went for about 6 fills. Then went to radiation for 6 weeks. My skin looked great so I am actually having my implants put in next week. The expanders are hard and uncomfortable at first. You do get use to them. I chose this route. You have time to decide what you want so really research it. Take care and good luck. JoJo
Posts.Title: mastectomy/reconstruction 1 2

Posts.Content: Hi there, Ya I think that is about right. I had the same thing done and I think I got results in 4 days. But I actually knew someone so I think that helped me. But I believe a week is normal. Just try to relax but I know the waiting is the worst part of it all. Think positive. JoJo
Posts.Title: How long for results of breast biopsy?

Posts.Content: Hi Sydney, How are you doing? After my expander surgery it looked liked I had really small breasts. They were a little odd shaped. Felt like it went over towards my arm pit. My doctor put in I believe 150CC's during surgery. But it was nice to finally feel like I had breasts. They felt like rocks. Didnt move. I never wore a bra during the expansion. Just tank tops under my clothes, Bras didnt fit right. The permanent implant doesnt feel anything like the expander. I went with silicone which is a more natural feeling. I was expanded in a month. 5 times at 60'ccs each time. Once 1 week, then twice a week for the next 2 weeks. That was a total of 450 cc's with the initial 150 cc's. I had radiation starting on October 17 so had to be done with expanding. I got to expand one more time after radiation ended just 25 cc's on each side. That was a total of 475cc's. My implants are 450cc's. It was uncomfortable sleeping at night. I used pillows to sit up at night. I also took pain pills after the expansion just for 1-2 days. You do get use to it after awhile. They felt like they were in the way because they didnt move. And the pain does not last after a couple of days. Any questions please ask, Good luck, let me know how you do. JoJo
Posts.Title: mastectomy/reconstruction 1 2

Posts.Content: Hi Sydney, I am very sorry to hear about your lungs. I will pray that it is nothing. I had the double mast in April 07, and didn't have my expanders put in until Sept 07, because of a timing issue. When I woke up from the expander surgery I was in a lot of pain. The expander went under the muscle and he expanded me a little during surgery. Not sure if the pain was so bad because it had been 5 months since the mast surgery and the expanders really had to stretch my skin. I went for about I think 6 fills. The fill itself doesnt hurt. But the more I got the more I had pain after, which lasted a couple of days. I had to be filled very quickly because of radiation starting. So I only had about 6 weeks to get filled. The expanders are very hard and uncomfortable. Use to sleep on my back sitting up a little. On January 26 I had the expanders out and went with silicone implants. It feels so much better now. I wish you all the luck. Take Care, JoJo
Posts.Title: mastectomy/reconstruction 1 2

Posts.Content: Hi Sydney, I did think the drains were a pain. If you accidently pulled the tube it hurt around the incision. I had a tank top that had velcro pockets that the drains sat in. It was nice. You do have to empty them and keep track. You will probably have them in a few days to a week maybe. It feels so much better after they come out. I would say the pain came from the muscle stretching. Every time they expand you they are making a pocket big enough for the implant to go into. The sleeping issue was just from the pain the first couple of days, then it was just hard to get comfortable because they were so hard. Just prop yourself up with a couple of pillows behind you. I was able to sleep on my side after awhile. I mainly slept on my back at first. I wish you luck, do you have to have chemo or radiation? My prayers are with you, keep me posted. JoJo
Posts.Title: mastectomy/reconstruction 1 2

Posts.Content: Hi Sydney, How are you doing? I got the tank top at a store that specialized in this type of stuff. They sold wigs, bras, hats, bathing suits etc. I wish you well, keep me posted. JoJo
Posts.Title: mastectomy/reconstruction 1 2

Posts.Content: Hi there, I would definately have a mamogram done. Have you ever had one? Please do not wait, it is probably nothing but you should definately have it checked. Do you have a breast care center in your area? Or just call a family doctor and get a referral for a mamogram. That will show if the lymph node has anything to do with the breast. Take Care, JoJo
Posts.Title: ?lump arm pit and back pain

Posts.Content: Hi Suggi, I Had A Double Mast In April, And 7 Nodes Removed From The Left Arm. I Have My Blood Pressure And Blood Taken Every Week Because Of Chemo In The Right Arm And That Is Fine. But I Was Told Do Not Have Anything Done To The Left Arm Because Of The Lymph Nodes. Take Care, Jojo
Posts.Title: Ductile Carcinoma 1 2 3

Posts.Content: My prayers and thoughts are with your wife and yourself. I also went through 4 treatments of A/C and four treatments of taxol. I finished 6 weeks of radiation the end of November. One chemo down for her that is great. Just keep positive she will get through this. Every treatment she has is closer to the end. The taxol was much easier for me. Please keep us posted on how she is doing and ask any questions that you have, JoJo
Posts.Title: Possible breast cancer 1 2

Posts.Content: Hi Susie, I would not wait either, I would demand maybe an ultrasound. They say calcifications can be normal unless they change in shape and size or clump together. You really have to be pushy and demand what you want. Take Care and good luck, JoJo
Posts.Title: Breast calcification - age 44

Posts.Content: Hi Angie, Hopefully it is nothing, but please get a second opinion. Ask for a mamogram or a ultrasound. I would demand it, it is your body. You really have to take charge of your own body. It is nice when a doctor says dont worry about it but there is always that doubt. And you need a piece of mind. Call him back or someone else. Take Care, JoJo
Posts.Title: Fibrocystic breast tissue, swollen painful armpit lump, hurt all over -- I am scared!

Posts.Content: Hi Kd, Good luck tomorrow. You will be fine. I had a double mast in April, had the two drains for about 1 week. They were easy to take care of. I also had the camisole it was the best thing I got. My insurance paid for it. You will feel better once the drain comes out. I think I stayed home from work for two weeks and drove after two weeks. I have had 5 chemo treatments so far, 3 more to go. I have not had reconstructive surgery yet. I am going in after chemo for my expanders. Like you said it's not a arm or leg. I was actually fine after surgery when I finally looked at myself. It is a big change but I accepted it fine. I will say a prayer for you. Good luck and take care, you will do just fine. JoJo
Posts.Title: well, now have to have mastectomy; lumpectomy not enough.

Posts.Content: Hi Guys, Just reading your posts. I actually had a swollen lymp node under my left armpit, which my family doctor told me nothing to worry about because it moved around and was squishy. I went back in two weeks to have it checked again and she said same thing. I am 39 and have been going for mamos since 35 because of my mother having breast cancer 18 years ago. I was scheduled for my mamo at end of April and made my doctor move it up to March. Found out I had breast cancer in my left breast. Had a bilateral mast on April 12. The cancer had spread to 4 of the left nodes under my left arm pit. Yours hopefully in absolutely nothing. THey say 80% of lumps are benign. I would just push for a mamo, mri and biopsy if needed. Take care, Best of luck. JoJo
Posts.Title: Lump under arm

Posts.Content: Hi Khilt08, If it is still there I would have her have it checked. It could be anything, how big is it? Sometimes swollen lymph nodes are the result of an infection or scratch. Could be a pimple. Mine moved around. Just for a piece of mind make her have it checked, it might just go away. JoJo
Posts.Title: Lump under arm

Posts.Content: Hi, I would call your oncologist now and have them schedule a mamogram, or an ultrasound, I would not wait. I lot of lumps are nothing but you never know. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Armpit lump or no lump? That is the question!

Posts.Content: Hi Phyl41, I finished chemo in August 07, and didnt get my period until April 08, Had a couple light ones after that, then this past November 08 got a bad one. Have not had once since. My oncologist and gyn both say its normal because of chemo. I am 41. I also just had hormones tests taken last week. JoJo
Posts.Title: Periods after Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Belle2003, So glad to hear everything came out fine. That must have been stressful waiting for the results. I was more stressed having tests than I was after they told me I had cancer. It was crazy. But definately everyone needs to get things checked right away and be persistent. When the doctors tell you to wait I wouldn't. Everyday is important. Take Care, JoJo
Posts.Title: Breast Calcifications

Posts.Content: Hi Girls, Just reading about the reconstruction. I had one consult with the plastic hand doctor. Not to sure about the whole thing. Too early for me to think about it but the whole tram flap thing from stomach area concerns me. Why not just have implants? I have not see any photos yet. Would they look the same. He did mention something about hernias. I love to work out, do not like hearing cant lift much weight. Oh well, too much to think about right now. I have to get through the chemo and radiation. It is 4 am I cannot sleep. Have not taken a zanax for 2 nights because wanting to try to wean off them. Have gone back to some pain pills at night because of the constant throb on my left armpit and arm area. Still have a lot of numbness. No relief. Will be 2 weeks tomorrow that bilateral mast was done. Everything else feels great. It is just where the lymph nodes were removed. Going to meet a physical therapist for this arm tomorrow. Oh well going to try to lay back down. Kids go back to school today from vacation. Does anyone else have problem sleeping????? Everyone have a great day and take care. JoJo
Posts.Title: Arimidex 1 2 3 4 5 Last Page

Posts.Content: Hi there, I am also new to this board but have learned a lot lately. I also have had breast calcifications the last few years. Which this past year they changed in shape and were clumped together. It was cancer. I am 39 and have been having mamos since I was 35 for family history. They had me go in for a breast MRI which I did then the biopsy. But hopefully yours is nothing calcifications are normal as long as they dont change in shape and size. But I would push for another mamo or mri now. I wouldn't wait. I had my mamo a month earlier than Iwas suppose to because of a swollen lymph node under my armpit. One doctor said it was nothing to worry about but I pushed to have my mamo earlier. I have already had my bilateral mast. Sometimes you just got to go with your gut feeling. Take care and I hope everything is fine. JoJo
Posts.Title: Breast Calcifications

Posts.Content: Hi Girls, Well up again 4th night in a row, So just gave in and took a Zanax, but will talk to my oncologist about the melatoin. I think I remember them telling me no vitamins during chemo is that correct? Not sure which ones. I have to look into that also. I spoke with a woman tonight who has already finished her treatment and did Reiki, acupuncture and massage during her chemo treatments, She said it helped her a lot. Has anyone done this? Why no soy? I don't eat it but just wondering. Well going to lay down hopefully this pill will work soon. Have a great day. JoJo
Posts.Title: Arimidex 1 2 3 4 5 Last Page

Posts.Content: Hi Girls, Just wondering if any of you used a cream to rub on your skin after surgery. Someone had told me cocoa butter but just wondering if anyone has and advice. I am pretty healed. Thanks so much. Everyone have a great evening. JoJo
Posts.Title: Arimidex 1 2 3 4 5 Last Page

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, I hope everybody had a great day. Awesome weather today. Teresa I am also divorced after 17 years, 3 kids. I have my kids 24 7. I love them so much and I am enjoying it. It is a lot of work, as everyone knows. CJ, thanks for the info on the implants, that is what I think I want to do, I had one doctor tell me I had to wait to after radiation, then the radiation doctor told be she wants my expanders put in before radiation. So I think they need to talk and figure this out. The surgeon did leave some skin there, I was probably a big B before the surgery. Linda how long were you on Xanax for? It has only been about a month for me and I didnt take it Sat or Sun night and I was up all night, But I did take my pain pills both nights so I dont know if it is from that or not. My arm is just so bad, so sensitive to touch, numb, throbbing, I have been using ice, It will be 2 weeks tomorrow so I know I have to be patient. Just didnt expect all this pain in the arm area. The rest of the surgery feels ok. Is it hard to get off the xanax? I just figured one less pill, but if I have to take it I will. It does work good. What kinds of nuts and seeds do you guys eat for protein. Will be starting chemo in probably 2 weeks, I want to eat as healthy as I can. You guys are the experts. I wish everyone a joyful night. I am going to try to get some sleep. I am so blessed to have come across this site and able to speak with all you guys. It makes me feel better, I know it will be a long road this summer. But I am going to stay strong. Take Care, JoJo
Posts.Title: Arimidex 1 2 3 4 5 Last Page

Posts.Content: Hi Linda, Thanks For The Advice, I Will Mention That To My Doctor. Start Chemo On Friday, Getting A Little Nervous Of What To Expect. I Went To A Chemo Class That My Doctors Office Held. A Little Over Whelming. But Lots Of Good Info. Hope All Is Fine With You And Everyone Else. Take Care, Jojo
Posts.Title: Arimidex 1 2 3 4 5 Last Page

Posts.Content: Thanks you guys. I really appreaciate all the input. I am a little nervous tonight. Just not knowing I guess. I am getting the adriamycin and cytoxan. But I am ready to kick its a_ _!!!!!!!!!My 16 year old daughter is taking me. She really wanted to go for the first visit so I am letting her. I have a prescription I have to take an hr before chemo for nausea. Then a pill on days 2, 3, and 4. I am ready and just want it to be over with. One down tomorrow. Everyone have a great weekend and thanks for everything. JoJo
Posts.Title: Arimidex 1 2 3 4 5 Last Page

Posts.Content: Well girls had the chemo today. They gave me the decadron, ativan, aloxi for nausea, I also took a emend before chemo, and have to take 1 on days 2 and 3. Have to take decadron tonight twice sat and twice sun. My stomach is very upset. I think it is from the nausea pills. I also got the shot Neulasta before I left. I have a lot of burbing and very upset stomach, took some tums but they dont work. Someone suggested zantac but I have to check with the doctor. Had some soup and saltines tonight that is all I could stand. Talk to you later. JoJo
Posts.Title: Arimidex 1 2 3 4 5 Last Page

Posts.Content: Linda awesome news on your mamo. That is great!!!!!Yes they gave me Compazine if the nausea persists. I am getting a little chest pain this morning from the nuesta (sp.) shot. They also mentioned advil and clairton for that. Oh well, it is a nice day out I think I might get outside for a walk later. After I go and take all these 100 pills. lol. Have a great day and celebrate... JoJo
Posts.Title: Arimidex 1 2 3 4 5 Last Page

Posts.Content: HI everyone, I got some zantac today seemed to help with the upset stomach. A little tired this afternoon. My daughter is a huge help, thank god for her. She took me to chemo and has been my little helper ever since. The boys are great also, but they are young and rather be out with their friends playing. Which is great. I hope everyone has a awesome mothers day, you all deserve it. Take care.... JoJo
Posts.Title: Arimidex 1 2 3 4 5 Last Page

Posts.Content: Hi Guys, Had my first taxol today. Started out with decadron, tagamet, then benadryl to prevent allergic reaction. The taxol took 3 hours but had no reaction. Did not have the neulasta shot this time. Didn't know about the glutamine I will have to ask about it. What do you mix it with water, juice?? Tylersnana that is awesome you have not had any problems yet. Hopefully you wont. You didnt get any bone pain a few days after treatment? They said if I did it probably would be on day 3. So I will just have to wait. Do you have any problems with the A/C? Thanks for the info. JoJo
Posts.Title: Taxol...need info

Posts.Content: Hi Martha, Just like you said, the expander surgery, which I had 5 months after the mast, was the worst by far. The implant surgery was a piece of cake compare to that. I was in and out in about 4.5 hours. It is a relief to get the expanders out. I had two drains for 5 days. I can sleep on my side now. Not on my stomach though. Every thing came out great and I am happy. Feeling really good now. I am going to go back for the nipple and tattoo. Keep me posted on how you make out. When are you going in for surgery> Take Care, JoJo
Posts.Title: ?'s about expanders and implants!

Posts.Content: Hi Cross, I also had a bilateral mast and had tissue expanders put it. I had mine filled to 475 cc's on both sides. I also had the same problem as you, every time I told him I wanted to be a C, he said everyone is different, we dont go by cup size. He said my fills were done at I think 390cc's and I asked for more. I was expanded once more 60 cc's and then again at 25 cc's, only because I pushed the issue. The expanders were only a certain size and I was over expanded. I just had my silicone implants put in 3 weeks ago. He ordered 450 cc's and 500 cc's. He went with the 450's the 500's would not fit. I have to wear wireless bras for right now. I got a few 34C bras and they fit good. So I would say I am a good C. How many fills have you had and do you know what number you are at? Bras dont fit right when you have the expanders in. The implant is so much different in shape and way more comfortable. Do you know what type you are going with. I know they say everybody is different depends on your body. I had no breast tissue left so 450 is a good size but not to big. Take care and good luck. JoJo
Posts.Title: ?'s about expanders and implants!

Posts.Content: Hi Girls, Thanks for all the great advice. I really appreciate it. There is just so much to learn. I went to my physical therapist today. It was just for one appt only. They give you streching exercises for the arm that the nodes were removed. I have to do them tonight see if I can get any relief. Wow Linda that accident sounded horrible, that is too bad. So you took longer to heal. Thanks you both for the pill information. Oh and have to look forward to menopause also. Boy, look at everything us women have to go through. Well everyone have a great night. Take Care, JoJo
Posts.Title: Arimidex 1 2 3 4 5 Last Page

Posts.Content: Hi Teresa, Thanks for the advise, I am going to try something. Wish it was hot here, we actually had sun and I think it got up to 62. Was pretty nice but want warmer weather. Take Care. JoJo
Posts.Title: Arimidex 1 2 3 4 5 Last Page

Posts.Content: Thanks so much CJ. I am ready......Will I feel anything on Friday or this weekend??????
Posts.Title: Arimidex 1 2 3 4 5 Last Page

Posts.Content: Hi Linda and girls: Just wanted to double check with you about the Neulasta Shot, I had it on Friday after the chemo and my chest still feels heavy and some bone pain. Do you remember how long the pain lasted? Went to work today and came home and took a nap. First treatment did wipe me out a little. Stomach still feels a little upset. Finished my nausea pills last night. I hope everyone had a great mothers day and is feeling good. Take Care, JoJo
Posts.Title: Arimidex 1 2 3 4 5 Last Page

Posts.Content: Hi Lynne, I hear you, I would call your gyn also. It doesn't hurt to get a second opinion. Good Luck and take care, JoJo
Posts.Title: Calcifications

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I just finished 4 AC treatments, now I am starting Taxol on Friday. Heard it was easier just wanted to know if everyone who has done it could give me their opinion. Thanks so much, hope everyone is doing well. JoJo
Posts.Title: Taxol...need info

Posts.Content: Hi Jgore, Thanks so much for sharing this with me. I still have my eyebrows and lashes and was hoping I was not going to lose them. Oh well... How soon did your bone pain start after the treatment and how long did it last? That I am not looking forward to. The neulasta shot to me was the worst. I got extreme bone pain 4 days after I got it and nothing helped. Do your counts go down with Taxol also? Thanks so much, JoJo
Posts.Title: Taxol...need info

Posts.Content: Hi, I also had calcifications for 3 years and they did not change until this year age 39. There were more of them and they were clumped together, I had a biopsy and it was breast cancer. They do say usually calcifications are benign. Hopefully yours will stay that way but just keep up on the mamograms and if you have any changes demand a biopsy. JoJo
Posts.Title: Calcifications

Posts.Content: Hi Lynne, I had stage 2 breast cancer. There was no lump in my breast that you could feel, and the cancer spread to my lymph nodes under my armpit. The calcifications had changed this year in my mamo, I have been having them since age 35 because my mom had breast cancer 17 years ago and then in the other breast 7 years ago, and she is doing great. I chose to have a double mast, then had chemo. I have one more treatment than 6 weeks of radiation. I wish you well, just keep on top of it and you demand what you want. Take Care, JoJo
Posts.Title: Calcifications

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by babygirl127 I am going through the same thing. I am 42, had my annual mammogram back in May and I have calcifications as well. I have a cyst that was aspirated a few times and it keeps coming back but sent to the lab and all ok. So this is the first time I ever heard "calcifications", I am told to go back in 6 months (Nov) for a follow-up mammogram. I am trying not to think or worry about it. Neither the mammogram place or my doctor seem concerned. They mentioned they are just checking for stability which I think they are doing for you as well. Keeping fingers crossed all ok for the both of us.
Posts.Title: Calcifications
